hints.content:
When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $8{,}610$ is one place to the left of the same digits in the number $861$.

Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |:-:
 | $\swarrow\purpleD8$ | $\swarrow\blueD6$ | $\swarrow\greenC1$ 
$\purpleD8$ | $\blueD6$ | $\greenC1$ | $0$

Moving each digit to the left means multiplying by $10$:

$\purpleD8{,}\blueD6\greenD10 = \purpleD8\blueD6\greenD1\times10$

question.content:
**Complete the equation with a $\times$ or $\div$ sign.**
 

$8{,}610=861$  [[☃ dropdown 1]]   $10$
